intro: Codonoboea crenata, commonly known as the serrated codonopsis, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, herbaceous stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a distinctive corona. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in horticulture.
